entries.title: Palestinian brothers killed after settler runs them over: Reports
entries.description: The brothers were fixing a tire when an Israeli settler 'deliberately' ran a car into them, local media reported.

entries.title: Match preview: Argentina vie to stop France making it 2 in a row
entries.description: Much more than a Messi vs Mbappe clash, the World Cup final will be a date with history for Argentina and France.

entries.title: Record low turnout, opposition boycott mar Tunisia elections
entries.description: Less than 9 percent of voters turned up to cast their ballot amid an opposition boycott of parliamentary elections.

entries.title: Ukraine scrambles to restore power, water after Russian attacks

entries.title: Morocco coach sure African team to win World Cup in ’15-20 years’
entries.description: Walid Regragui, whose side finished fourth in Qatar, says he hopes the performance will leave lasting legacy.

entries.title: A second chance: How Argentina reached the World Cup final again
entries.description: Argentina's Lionel Messi hopes to bring the trophy home in his last World Cup game as they face France in the final.

entries.title: How France reached the Qatar World Cup 2022 final
entries.description: After tournament full of mental strength and moments of brilliance, France hope to win the World Cup for a third time.

entries.title: Famous Iranian actress arrested after supporting protesters

entries.title: What does Peru’s worsening political crisis mean for its people?

entries.title: How can we end the hunger pandemic?
entries.description: We need a new approach that seeks to reinforce, not replace, national and local systems.

entries.title: Modric says he’ll keep playing for Croatia after Qatar World Cup
entries.description: Captain, 37, says he will continue international career after Croatia clinches third spot in tournament in Qatar.

entries.title: Photos: Croatia claim third place at World Cup with Morocco win
entries.description: Led by captain Luka Modric, Croatia beat Morocco 2-1 in third-place playoff at football World Cup in Qatar.

entries.title: Peru president urges Congress to approve early polls amid unrest
entries.description: Dina Boluarte asks Congress to sign off on early elections as she refuses to resign despite the worsening protests.

entries.title: Croatia edge past Morocco for World Cup third place
entries.description: Croatia took full advantage of tired Moroccan legs to finish their Qatar run with a 2-1 victory.

entries.title: Turkey’s courts to fix any errors after Imamoglu jailing: Erdogan
entries.description: Opposition figure Ekrem Imamoglu was sentenced to two years and seven months in prison for insulting public officials.

entries.title: Heckling of President Ramaphosa triggers backlash in ruling ANC
entries.description: South Africa's president wants a second term and is seen as the party's strongest candidate despite a farm scandal.

entries.title: IMF approves $3bn support package for Egypt
entries.description: The deal aims to reduce government debt and strengthen the social protection network for citizens.

entries.title: Advertisers should fear more than the chaos at Twitter
entries.description: The opacity of the ad tech industry can be costly for brands. It's time to embrace surveillance-free advertising.

entries.title: Moldova suspends six TV channels over Russia-Ukraine war coverage
entries.description: Moldovan authorities allege channels have broadcast misinformation and inaccurate coverage of Russia's war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Why are Tunisia’s parliamentary elections so controversial?

entries.title: Elon Musk restores suspended Twitter accounts of journalists

entries.title: Tunisians trickle in to vote in elections as opposition boycotts
entries.description: President Saied's rule changes have been met with anger from the opposition and apathy from much of the public.

entries.title: At least 169 dead after devastating floods in DR Congo’s Kinshasa
entries.description: The UN estimated 2.9 million people have been displaced by severe flooding in west and central Africa.

entries.title: UN postpones decision on ambassadors from Myanmar, Taliban, Libya
entries.description: UN recognising ambassadors from Myanmar's military, the Taliban, and Libya’s east would be seen a conferring legitimacy.

entries.title: Fresh from World Cup game, France ends Morocco visa restrictions
entries.description: More than 780,000 people of Moroccan origin live in France; visa restrictions made it difficult for relatives to visit.

entries.title: Pentagon’s UFO investigation finds no evidence of alien activity
entries.description: The US Office of the Director of National Intelligence reported 144 encounters with UFOs between 2004 and 2021.
